column4: you need linux-source if you want to compile third-party modules against the kernel you're running
yes, got it. I used kernel-source in Hardy, but Jaunty recognized all hardware fine (althoug it doesn't work) :)
if you compile a custom kernel, you'll have to compile a custom nvidia driver, too (for example)
noodlesgc - installed, rebooting now. wish me luck! :). thanks guys.
